intro: Sticherus hirtus var. hirtus, commonly known as the hairy sticherus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which are typically alternate and pinnately lobed. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, a common feature in the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
